title: Lava Flow on Volcán de Fuego
description: Lava spilling down the slopes of Guatemala’s Volcán de Fuego, one of Central America’s most active volcanoes. The latest bout of activity began on September 4, 2016, when lava rose as high as 200 meters (650 feet) above Fuego’s crater rim. Plumes of ash have reached heights of about 850 meters (2,800 feet).
